references.reason: This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models, a class of generative models that has revolutionized image generation and forms the basis for ColorFlow.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This work introduced Stable Diffusion, a specific type of latent diffusion model that is highly effective for image generation and serves as the foundation for ColorFlow's architecture.

references.paper_title: Adding conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: ControlNet, presented in this paper, provides a framework for adding conditional control to diffusion models, which is essential for guiding the colorization process in ColorFlow.

references.paper_title: LoRA: Low-rank adaptation of large language models
references.reason: This paper introduced Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA), a technique for fine-tuning large models efficiently which ColorFlow utilizes for adapting the pretrained diffusion model to the colorization task.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This work introduced CLIP, a powerful model that learns visual concepts from natural language, and ColorFlow employs CLIP for image encoding and retrieval in its pipeline.
